0.name: Cerscospora
0.description: Small brown or grey spots with light centers, often enlarging and merging, caused by Cercospora coffeicola.
0.recommendation: Remove infected leaves, maintain proper spacing, and apply protective fungicides. Ensure good drainage to prevent fungal growth. Use resistant varieties if available. Monitor regularly for early detection.

1.name: Healthy
1.description: Leaf shows no visible disease symptoms. Uniform green color and normal texture.
1.recommendation: Maintain good agronomic practices, regular monitoring, and balanced fertilization. Continue preventive measures like proper pruning and weed control. Keep soil pH balanced and ensure adequate irrigation.

2.name: Leaf rust
2.description: Orange or yellow powdery spots, usually on the underside of leaves, caused by Hemileia vastatrix.
2.recommendation: Remove and destroy infected leaves, improve air circulation, and apply recommended fungicides. Plant rust-resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation. Apply fungicides preventively during rainy seasons.

3.name: Phoma
3.description: Dark brown to black lesions, often with yellow halos, caused by Phoma spp.
3.recommendation: Prune affected branches, avoid overhead irrigation, and apply copper-based fungicides. Improve air circulation around plants. Use clean pruning tools. Apply fungicides as a preventive measure.
